1. Mindfulness Meditation Workshop: Offer a guided mindfulness meditation session, led by a trained facilitator, to help attendees learn techniques for managing stress and anxiety. This could be particularly useful for those who are new to meditation or looking for ways to integrate mindfulness into their daily lives.
2. Mental Health First Aid Training: Provide a brief training session on Mental Health First Aid, teaching participants how to identify, understand, and respond to signs of mental health issues in themselves and others. This can help empower the community to provide support and reduce the stigma associated with mental health.
3. Interactive Art Therapy Zone: Set up a designated area where attendees can engage in various art-based activities, such as painting, drawing, or crafting. Art therapy is a proven method for reducing stress and promoting emotional healing. Encourage participants to express their feelings and emotions through art, promoting self-discovery and healing.
4. Virtual Reality Experience: Partner with a local VR company to create an immersive experience that simulates the perspective of someone living with a mental health condition. This can help attendees better understand the challenges faced by those with mental health issues and foster empathy.
5. Mental Health Trivia and Games: Organize a series of mental health-themed trivia and games that educate participants on various mental health topics while also providing an entertaining and engaging experience.
6. Support Group Meet-and-Greet: Facilitate an opportunity for attendees to connect with local mental health support groups and organizations. This could involve setting up a designated area for representatives from various support groups to share information and resources, as well as answer any questions.
7. Panel Discussion: Organize a panel discussion featuring mental health professionals, community leaders, and individuals with lived experience. This could be an excellent opportunity for attendees to ask questions and gain insights into various mental health topics and issues.
8. Yoga and Movement Workshops: Offer a series of workshops focused on yoga and other movement-based practices that promote mental well-being. These workshops could target different age groups, such as children, adults, or seniors, and cater to various skill levels.

By incorporating a diverse range of interactive community engagement activities, the BHS Communication and Engagement Team can effectively support the Second Annual "Change Your Mind" Festival. The variety of activities will appeal to a broad audience, helping to educate and destigmatize mental health while empowering the community to take action.
